parse: Verb - Aorist Optative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Unconcealed, true, true in fact, worthy of credit, truthful. TRUE.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
A liar, deceiver. From pseudomai; a falsifier.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
A primary particle, denoting a supposition, wish, possibility or uncertainty.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From dikaios; to render just or innocent.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To conquer, be victorious, overcome, prevail, subdue. From nike; to subdue.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
